Issues.Title: MFT_MENUBREAK or MFT_MENUBARBREAK flags for ContextMenuStrip
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

Unlike `ContextMenu`, `ContextMenuStrip` seems to be missing the `MFT_MENUBREAK` or `MFT_MENUBARBREAK` flags.

Please implement these.

Perhaps via `ToolStripProfessionalRenderer`?


### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

As shown above.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

ContextMenuStrip
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MFT_MENUBREAK or MFT_MENUBARBREAK flags for ContextMenuStrip" (#7818)

Issues.Title: TextBox should set IsPassword accessible property when it contains password
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22423.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Worked in .NET 6 but not in .NET 7, didn't check earlier versions

### Issue description

From [Edit docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winauto/uiauto-supporteditcontroltype#relevant-properties) on [UIA_IsPasswordPropertyId](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winauto/uiauto-automation-element-propids) property:

> Must be set to TRUE on edit controls that contain passwords. If an edit control does contain Password contents then this property can be used by a screen reader to determine whether keystrokes should be read out as the user types them.

There are `UseSystemPasswordChar` and `PasswordChar` properties on `TextBox` that allow formatting content as password.

### Current behavior:

When setting either `UseSystemPasswordChar` or `PasswordChar` properties on a `TextBox`, the `IsPassword` property stays `False`. 

![A screenshot of a form with 2 text boxes formatted as passwords. Accessibility Insights app shows that IsPassword property is false](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/191551252-40912925-fcf4-45a7-b9d2-64699ad0134e.png)

Narrator announces all symbols entered into such text boxes.

### Expected behavior:

When setting either `UseSystemPasswordChar` or `PasswordChar` properties on a `TextBox`, the `IsPassword` property becomes `True`, and screen readers don't announce characters entered into it. 

### Steps to reproduce

Sample application:
[TextBoxPasswordSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9618282/TextBoxPasswordSample.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TextBox should set IsPassword accessible property when it contains password" (#7816)

Issues.Title: TextBox should set HelpText accessible property when it contains placeholder text
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22423.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

From [Edit docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winauto/uiauto-supporteditcontroltype):

> If an edit control contains placeholder text (for example, a cue banner), the text should be used as the HelpText property unless the text can be edited by the user and then reused as placeholder text. For example, the Windows Internet Explorer address bar contains the text "about:Tabs" when a new tab is opened. This is not HelpText because it is a programmatic address that can be used or edited by the user.

There is a `PlaceholderText` property on a `TextBox` which acts as a placeholder. It cannot be edited by the user and disappears when `TextBox` gets focus, thus needs to be exposed as a `HelpText`.

### Current behavior:

When setting `PlaceholderText` property on a `TextBox` with empty text, the `HelpText` property stays empty, and placeholder isn't announced by screen readers. 

![A screenshot of a form with 3 text boxes, where the second TextBox has a placeholder text. Accessibility Insights app shows that HelpText property is empty on a second text box](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/191537863-d5c3ef16-8a38-48b6-a132-9b205f88c806.png)

Narrator Buddy output when switching between these TextBoxes:

> edit, Text box 1, 
> edit, 
> edit, Text box 3, 

Placeholder text is not announced.

### Expected behavior:
When `PlaceholderText` is non-empty and `Text` is empty, `HelpText` accessible property should have value of `PlaceholderText`. As a result, it should also be announced by screen readers. 

### Steps to reproduce

Sample application:
[TextBoxPlaceholderSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9617884/TextBoxPlaceholderSample.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TextBox should set HelpText accessible property when it contains placeholder text" (#7815)

Issues.Title: [release/7.0] Fixing the border's color of TextBox inside MenuStrip
Issues.Body:
Backport of #7759 to release/7.0

/cc @Tanya-Solyanik @NikitaSemenovAkvelon

# MenuStripTextBoxes don't have visible borders in HightContrast themes

## Description
Before
![No Border around TextBox In HighContrast](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15823268/191387049-f348e20a-837c-4b1b-8f8d-ca9eb207168c.png)

After - 
Draw a border in HighContrast themes using the standard color for menu borders.

![Same Border Around TextBox As We Have Around ComboBoxes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15823268/191387112-28192f1b-6a2c-45a3-b4da-e4c7b325ef6d.png)

Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7740

## Customer Impact
Customer does not know that this is an input field when using High Contrast mode.

## Regression?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Risk

- [ ] High
- [ ] Medium
- [x] Low - restricted to HighContrast mode and the same color is used in Buttons

## Verification

- [x] Manual (required) - Win10.Win11, on HighContrast and regular themes
- [ ] Automated

## Packaging changes reviewed?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No
- [x] N/A

----

Issues.Title: DataGridView Flaky tests due to invalidatedCallCount
Issues.Body:
### Test

DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode_SetNonResizeThenResize_RestoresOldValue
DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeight_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeight_SetWithParentWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_OnColumnHeadersHeightChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsColumnHeadersHeightChanged
DataGridView_OnColumnHeadersHeightSizeModeChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsColumnHeadersHeightSizeModeChanged
DataGridView_OnRowHeadersWidthChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsRowHeadersWidthChanged
DataGridView_OnRowHeadersWidthSizeModeChanged_InvokeWithHandle_CallsRowHeadersWidthSizeModeChanged
DataGridView_Parent_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_RowHeadersWidthSizeMode_SetNonResizeThenResize_RestoresOldValue
DataGridView_RowHeadersWidthSizeMode_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_RowHeadersWidth_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_RowHeadersWidth_SetWithParentWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected
DataGridView_TopLeftHeaderCell_GetWithHandle_ReturnsExpected
DataGridView_TopLeftHeaderCell_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected

### Issue description

All these tests may randomly fail due to extra invalidations. This happens when the mouse pointer is above any cell of DataGridView. We can't properly fix this now because of:
- UTs are run in parallel therefore we can't set the mouse pointer and guarantee that it will not be moved until the test is done.
- DataGridView without columns does not visually display the left top header, but still tries to invalidate it's area.

Affected issues:
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6597 It's hard to say if they are all, but probably yes.
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6739
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6926
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView Flaky tests due to invalidatedCallCount" (#7799)

Issues.Title: The color picker does not support Alpha in ARGB
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Version 17.4.0 Preview 2.0


### .NET version

N/A

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Don't know but I don't think so.

### Issue description

The color picker only supports Red, Green and Blue but the underlying designer supports the Alpla Channel.


### Steps to reproduce

Select any design item that is of type Color, select custom and there is no option to add Alpha.


### Diagnostics

_No response_
